segments.text: I'm just standing here, watching, and I can't quite believe my eyes.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can someone be so utterly unaware of their surroundings?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is literally pouring over the edge of the sink!
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s forming a lake right where she’s standing, yet she doesn't react.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And the children, oh, the children are up to no good at all.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: They’re practically performing an acrobatic feat to get those cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene feels like a snapshot of domestic blindness.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's genuinely perplexing to witness such a complete lack of observation.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I find myself wanting to shout out, to warn them of the impending doom.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Someone needs to turn off that faucet immediately.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This mess is only going to get worse the longer it goes unnoticed.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The wasted water alone is quite frustrating to see.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s a peculiar tableau of everyday life gone quietly, utterly wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: My disbelief just keeps growing with every passing second.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This level of detachment from reality is truly remarkable.
segments.speaker: PAR
